blogPosts.title: Understanding JavaScript Closures
blogPosts.content: JavaScript closures are a powerful feature that allows functions to have access to variables from their outer scope even after the outer function has finished executing.
blogPosts.author: Jane Doe

blogPosts.title: A Guide to CSS Flexbox
blogPosts.content: CSS Flexbox is a layout model that provides an efficient way to lay out, align and distribute space among items in a container, even when their size is unknown.
blogPosts.author: John Smith

blogPosts.title: Getting Started with React
blogPosts.content: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows developers to create large web applications that can change data without reloading the page.
blogPosts.author: Alice Johnson
